content.raw:
The lighting for colored and textured collada models is pretty bad and causes models to be either lit to 100% or just with ambient light - the amount of actual shading is very minimal. The strength of the lighting is also independent of the distance to the object and the lighting looks a bit like all the normals would point in one direction even though all the normals are correct when viewed in Meshlab. Textures aren't affected by lighting at all.

STL models do get proper shading for the most part but a lot of aliasing and what seems to be z-buffer fighting is caused by shadows (?) or shading on the model.

See attached pictures and this video for examples using the google warehouse gator: http://youtu.be/ICuwtodhDHk
